name: Squadio
title: Junior Business Developer - KSA
description: gender: female/male level: junior-level experienced professional employment type: full-time visa sponsorship: no squadio is a global remote-first it service provider headquartered in riyadh ksa with delivery centers in egypt and ksa. our distributed teams are located in tunisia, egypt, ksa, palestine, nigeria & india. we were founded in 2011 in riyadh, ksa, as an app development company (previously ibtikar technologies) successfully pivoted our model to support the growing need of startups and companies seeking to hire and manage their own engineering team remotely with engineers vetted by squadio’s talent community. we are looking for a junior business developer. your role will be to seek new business opportunities by establishing and developing relationships with potential customers. you will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you close the deal. duties/responsibilities: qualify leads as sales opportunities assisting the team in developing a new client base through identifying potential clients in the target market and research the market trends to identify the customer demand for the proposed products and services stay up-to-date with new products/services coordinate with management to research, identify, analyze and execute new business initiatives identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services to increase customer satisfaction participate in executive events and meetings to represent the company develop strong relationships with prospective clients for new opportunities while maintaining long-term trusting relationships with existing clients negotiate contract terms with clients and communicate terms to stakeholders become a subject matter expert on our business services, processes and operations, and remain up-to-date on industry news collect customer requirements and business data to develop a business plan that meets these requirements work with the internal departments and external partners to execute business plans and strategies report sales results to management on a regular basis coordinate with management to review and improvise the relevant business development activities requirements job requirements works well autonomously and as part of a team excellent organizational skills and attention to detail and takes pride in their work excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines research skills and analytical thinking. innovation and problem-solving skills that include the ability to develop and propose solutions for clients strong negotiation and decision-making skills excellent listening and presentation abilities ability to prioritize tasks ability to manage multiple projects and responsibilities simultaneously ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment a strong communicator with excellent writing skills self-motivated, proactive, enthusiastic and eager to learn determined and flexible with an upbeat positive approach education and experience: bsc degree in marketing, business administration or relevant field proven 1-2 year work experience as a business development representative, sales account executive or similar role.

name: Duncan & Ross
title: AI/ML ENGINEER
Industry Skills: ['data analysis', 'data visualization', 'deep learning', 'extract', 'machine learning', 'mathematics', 'model deployment', 'natural language processing', 'problem-solving skills', 'statistical analysis', 'statistics']
description: responsibilities: utilize strong statistical analysis skills to analyze large datasets and derive actionable insights. develop and implement machine learning algorithms and models to solve business problems and optimize processes. specialize in implementing retrieval augmented generation (rag) applications to enhance information retrieval and generation capabilities. collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into ai/ml solutions. utilize python for data analysis, model development, and deployment in production environments. apply advanced nlp techniques to extract insights from unstructured text data and develop text-based ai applications. utilize deep learning techniques to build and deploy state-of-the-art neural network models for various tasks. develop data visualization dashboards and reports to communicate findings and insights to stakeholders. stay up-to-date with the latest research and advancements in ai/ml technologies and techniques. work with tools such as palantir foundry, aip, dataiku, or databricks uap to facilitate data management, analysis, and model deployment. qualifications: bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related field. proven experience in data analysis, machine learning, and ai, with a focus on implementing advanced models and applications. strong proficiency in python for data analysis, model development, and deployment. experience with retrieval augmented generation (rag) applications and natural language processing (nlp) techniques. familiarity with data visualization tools such as tableau, power bi, or matplotlib. knowledge of predictive modeling techniques and methodologies. experience with deep learning frameworks such as tensorflow or pytorch. familiarity with tools such as palantir foundry, aip, dataiku, or databricks uap is preferred. excellent problem-solving skills and a strong analytical mindset. strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment. vertical technology

name: Duncan & Ross
title: BIM ARCHITECT
description: as a bim (building information modeling) engineer specializing in multi-disciplinary projects, you will play a pivotal role in the successful execution of high-speed rail projects. your responsibilities will encompass a wide range of tasks aimed at integrating bim methodologies across various disciplines to optimize project workflows and outcomes. key responsibilities: bim coordination: collaborate with project stakeholders including architects, engineers, designers, and contractors to ensure seamless integration of bim processes throughout the project lifecycle. multi-disciplinary integration: lead the coordination efforts between different disciplines such as civil, structural, mechanical, electrical, and architectural to synchronize bim models and data, resolving clashes and conflicts. model development: develop and maintain detailed bim models for various project components including tracks, stations, tunnels, bridges, and associated infrastructure using industry-standard software such as autodesk revit, bentley microstation, or equivalent. standards compliance: ensure compliance with project-specific bim standards, protocols, and guidelines, as well as industry standards such as iso 19650, to maintain consistency and quality across all project deliverables. quality assurance: conduct regular reviews and audits of bim models to identify errors, discrepancies, and areas for improvement, and implement corrective actions as necessary to uphold the integrity and accuracy of project data. interdisciplinary collaboration: facilitate interdisciplinary workshops and meetings to foster communication and collaboration among project teams, promoting a culture of innovation and knowledge sharing. data management: manage bim data and documentation including drawings, schedules, and specifications, ensuring version control, file organization, and proper documentation of changes for effective project management and decision-making. training and support: provide training and technical support to project team members on bim software tools, workflows, and best practices, empowering them to leverage bim technologies effectively in their respective disciplines. performance optimization: identify opportunities to streamline workflows, improve efficiency, and enhance project outcomes through the implementation of advanced bim techniques such as parametric modeling, scripting, and automation. client liaison: serve as a point of contact for clients regarding bim-related matters, addressing their requirements, concerns, and feedback, and ensuring alignment with project objectives and expectations. key qualifications: bachelors degree in engineering, architecture, or related field. proven experience in bim coordination and implementation on large-scale infrastructure projects, preferably in the rail transportation sector. proficiency in bim software platforms such as autodesk revit, bentley microstation, or equivalent. strong understanding of bim standards, protocols, and workflows, with the ability to interpret and apply industry-specific requirements. excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment. familiarity with relevant regulations, codes, and standards governing high-speed rail projects is desirable. certification in bim-related technologies or processes is a plus. vertical: digital engineering

name: Duncan & Ross
title: PALANTIR FOUNDRY AND AIP ENGINEER
description: responsibilities: deploy and manage palantir foundry and aip applications, ensuring optimal performance and scalability. develop custom applications and solutions using javascript, typescript, workshop, slate, and other relevant technologies. integrate and customize palantir solutions to align with client requirements and business processes. collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement data integration strategies within the foundry and aip environments. ensure compliance with data privacy and security protocols, implementing best practices to safeguard sensitive information. provide technical expertise and support to clients and internal stakeholders, troubleshooting issues and optimizing system performance. stay updated with the latest features and capabilities of palantir platforms, incorporating new insights into solution design and implementation. requirements: bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field. strong working knowledge of javascript and typescript, with experience in building and customizing applications. expertise in deploying and managing palantir foundry and aip applications, including configuration and customization. experience with workshop, slate, and other palantir development tools. familiarity with data integration, privacy, and security protocols within palantir foundry and aip environments. excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues. strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and clients. vertical: technology

name: Duncan & Ross
title: DEV-OPS/SRE - ARABIC SPEAKER
description: description as a devops engineer, you will play a crucial role in bridging software development, quality assurance, and it operations. you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our ci/cd pipelines, ensuring the scalability and security of our infrastructure, and deploying docker and kubernetes solutions. your role involves leveraging your expertise in devops best practices along with a solid understanding of web development, cyber security, and digital systems to enhance the performance and reliability of our digital platforms. key responsibilities: design, implement, and maintain continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines to automate the software delivery process. implement and manage containerization with tools like docker and orchestrate containers using kubernetes to ensure scalable and efficient deployment. collaborate with development teams to automate repetitive tasks to improve efficiency and reduce the risk of human error. implement monitoring solutions for tracking application and infrastructure performance. use tools like prometheus, grafana, or new relic to monitor, analyze and report system performance data. work closely with development, operations, and other teams to ensure high-quality software development and deployment. diagnose and resolve technical issues in development, test, and production environments. monitor and improve system performance, stability, and security. conduct log analysis, error analysis, and resolution to enhance system functionality and reliability. stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in devops, software development, and it operations. document devops processes, systems, and configurations for effective knowledge sharing and collaboration. required qualification: bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field. at least 4 years of experience in devops, system administration, or related roles. proficiency in managing docker containers and orchestrating them with kubernetes. experience in building and maintaining ci/cd pipelines using tools like jenkins, gitlab ci, circleci, or similar. wide knowledge in digital systems infrastructure, performance monitoring, and troubleshooting. excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work effectively in a team environment. vertical: technology

name: Duncan & Ross
title: TESTING MANAGER
description: responsibilities: develop and implement comprehensive testing strategies and methodologies to ensure the quality and reliability of software products. lead and mentor a team of testers, providing guidance, support, and training as needed. define testing standards, processes, and best practices to be followed by the testing team. collaborate with project managers, developers, and other stakeholders to define testing requirements, scope, and timelines. plan and allocate resources effectively to meet project deadlines and objectives. oversee the creation and execution of test plans, test cases, and test scripts. coordinate with automation engineers to identify opportunities for test automation and implement automated testing solutions. monitor and analyze test results, identify defects and areas for improvement, and work with development teams to resolve issues. track and report on testing progress, including metrics such as test coverage, defect density, and defect trends. stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in testing tools, techniques, and methodologies. qualification: minimum 5 years of experience in designing test framework proficiency in software testing methodologies. experience in testing ai and data based applications, strong awareness of benchmarks and oss tooling available to create test workbench and frameworks. experience with automated testing tools. strong knowledge of quality assurance processes. experience in data-intensive applications testing is preferred. knowledge of palantir foundry and aip and related testing infrastructure is a plus. experience with databricks, informatica and data-driven testing design is a plus. vertical technology

name: Duncan & Ross
title: Mechanical BIM Coordinator
description: job overview: we are seeking a highly skilled mechanical bim coordinator with exceptional civil 3d, revit, navisworks and autocad capabilities, bim process knowledge, and bim 360 experience. the successful candidate will be responsible for managing and coordinating mechanical bim projects, ensuring project delivery on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. key responsibilities: manage and coordinate mechanical bim projects from inception to completion, ensuring compliance with project requirements, and bim standards. produce high-quality 3d models using civil 3d, revit, navisworks and autocad software, ensuring accuracy and completeness. collaborate with other disciplines to coordinate mep services and resolve any design clashes or issues. develop and maintain project schedules, ensuring project milestones are met, and resources are utilized effectively. provide technical expertise and support to project teams, including engineers, architects, and construction personnel. implement bim process workflows and standards, including bim 360, to improve project efficiency and collaboration. attend project meetings and provide progress updates, highlighting any issues or risks that may impact project delivery. develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including clients, contractors, and consultants. qualifications and requirements: bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or a related field. minimum of 5-7 years of experience in bim coordination, with a strong focus on mechanical engineering. proficient in civil 3d, revit, navisworks, and autocad software. extensive knowledge of bim processes, workflows, and standards, with experience in bim 360. strong knowledge of bim iso standards, including iso 19650, and ability to implement and comply with these standards in project deliverables. expertise in lod specifications and understanding of loi and loa requirements. experience producing design drawings, shop drawings, and as-built drawings from bim models using relevant software. exceptional knowledge of cobie and ability to implement cobie requirements in project deliverables. proficient in project parameters creation and schedules generation using relevant software. knowledge of 4d simulation and ability to create and implement 4d simulations in bim models. familiarity with 5d estimation and the ability to generate boqs from bim models. understanding of project workflows and the ability to optimize workflows for efficiency and accuracy. familiarity with construction sequencing and phasing and the ability to implement this knowledge in project planning. strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to make informed decisions based on data analysis. ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously while ensuring project deadlines are met. experience collaborating with multi-disciplinary teams, including architects, engineers, and contractors. excellent communication, organization, and project management skills. ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team environment. strong problem-solving skills and the ability to identify and resolve design clashes and issues. willingness to learn and adapt to new software and technologies as needed. if you possess the skills and experience required for this role, we encourage you to apply. we offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for professional development and career growth. vertical: digital engineering

name: AtkinsRéalis
title: Project Manager - Riyadh, KSA
description: as a provider of multi-disciplined technical services to the built environment, atkinsréalis middle east is committed to design excellence in the delivery of first-class solutions which combine innovation, imagination, and best practice. due to the tremendous growth we are currently experiencing, we currently have an opportunity for a project manager to work in our land development division – an integrated, dynamic team of planners, designers, engineers and project managers. our large, diverse and fast-growing portfolio allows an excellent opportunity for the successful candidate to grow their career and make a meaningful contribution to some of the most exciting projects across the the middle east. about atkinsréalis created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, atkinsréalis is a world leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. we create sustainable solutions that connect people, data, and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. we deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. the breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as engineering services, nuclear, operations & maintenance and capital. news and information are available at www.atkinsrealis.com or follow us on linkedin. project manager – land development (master planning, infrastructure, landscape) job summary: we are seeking a highly qualified and experienced project manager with a strong technical background in land development (infrastructure, transport planning, landscape, sustainability) to lead and oversee large, complex projects within our organization. the ideal candidate will possess the knowledge, skills, and experience to lead multi-disciplinary land development teams and drive these projects from inception to completion. key responsibilities: project leadership: lead and manage master planning / urban design / land development projects team management: build and lead cross-functional project teams, providing guidance, mentorship, and motivation to team members to achieve project goals. client interaction: cultivate and maintain strong client relationships, understand their needs, and ensure project deliverables meet or exceed client expectations whilst aligning with project budgets project management fundamentals: cost and resource management: develop project budgets, monitor and control expenditures, and allocate resources efficiently to optimize project outcomes. risk management: identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success. scope and schedule management: develop a work breakdown structure for the project, create schedules, monitor and control project progress against schedule. ensure scope and deliverables are well-defined. ensure variance and scope creep are identified and that change is adequately documented and managed. quality management: manage and control quality on the project by implementing atkinsréalis processes and templates and instilling and maintaining a quality culture across the project teams. procurement management: apply commercial and legal acumen (with the contributions of support functions) to manage procurement activities on the project, ensuring main agreement execution, change control and supplier/subcontractor appointments. stakeholder and communication management: establish stakeholder and communication management plans. ensure communication is efficiently and accurately flowing into and out of the project, in accordance with business protocols. evaluate stakeholder power and influence and ensure relevant feedback is considered and requisite approvals sought. land development design delivery: experience project managing land development type projects within the middle east (master planning, infrastructure), leading multi-disciplinary teams design oversight: work with design managers and technical leads to oversee the design process, ensuring that urban design principles, aesthetics, and functionality are integrated effectively into project plans. sufficient technical understanding of supporting disciplines and their requirements in order to ensure a balanced and robust master plan which is suitable for progression into future project stages regulatory compliance: stay updated with relevant planning and zoning regulations, and ensure projects adhere to all legal requirements. maintain a strong understanding and ensure compliance with relevant international, regional, local planning and land development technical standards. key candidate attributes: proven experience as a project manager on land development projects within the middle east proficiency in project management tools, processes and principles knowledge and understanding of urban planning principles, land use, zoning, and architectural design. strong understanding of the full land development project life cycle and technical disciplines (visioning, master planning, detailed design, construction, handover, operations) to allow sufficient foresight to be applied at early stages to ensure designability, buildability and maintainability. experience in leading multi-disciplinary teams (master planning, transport planning, infrastructure, landscaping, architecture etc) through land development type projects. experience leading projects post-master planning stage is advantageous. technical background in a land development discipline (master planning, transport planning, infrastructure, landscaping) is preferred, in addition to a secondary technical understanding of key supporting disciplines excellent leadership and team management skills. exceptional communication and presentation abilities. familiarity with local, regional, and international design standards relevant to land development knowledge and understanding of key middle east clients and stakeholders strong problem-solving and decision-making capabilities. knowledge of sustainability and green building practices is preferable gis (geographic information system) proficiency is preferable familiarity with 3d modelling and visualization tools is preferable familiarity with publishing and graphics tools such as indesign and illustrator is preferable multilingual ability is preferable middle east experience is preferable qualifications: degree in a land development related discipline (master planning, urban design, transport planning, infrastructure, landscaping) is preferred. pmp, mapm or other similar project management accreditations preferred working conditions: this role may require travel to project sites and meetings with clients, local authorities, and stakeholders. it may also involve occasional extended working hours to meet project deadlines. rewards & benefits: we offer an excellent package which includes: a competitive salary accommodation allowance transportation allowance annual leave medical and life insurance cover company gratuity scheme discretionary bonus scheme 22 working days annual leave (based on 5 days working a week) flight understood and implemented. complying with the relevant employment legislation and codes of practice. ensuring that all existing employees, potential employees, colleagues, and customers are treated race, ethnic origin, religious conviction, or disablement. making all decisions relating to recruitment, selection, or promotion according to the employees’ ability

name: AtkinsRéalis
title: Lifting Supervisor
description: join us in engineering a better future for our planet and its people. atkinsréalis is a world-leading design, engineering and project management organization. we connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. together, with our industry partners and clients, and our global team of consultants, designers, engineers and project managers, we can change the world. we have a strong presence in the middle east that enables us to build deep and lasting relationships with our clients. we share their goals and long-term ambitions; we’re on the same journey to create places and infrastructure which will support long term sustainable development, healthy living and vibrant communities. we are seeking a lifting supervisor who will oversee the creation of multiple forms of editorial content to enhance understanding, awareness and drive strong positive engagement for the line at neom. this position will work with teams across the organization to identify and tell inspiring stories that illustrate the exceptional work being delivered on the line at neom, how it will transform the built environment sector, and the work being delivered to lead the way on issues like sustainability, health & safety, and digitalization. reporting to the director of communications, the senior content manager will propose, draft and edit a wide range of material, including op-eds, success stories, research summaries, e-newsletters, and marketing materials. this position is responsible for maintaining the line’s intranet and stakeholder engagement materials. as a key member of the communications team, the role holder will have ample creative autonomy, and will be a keen collaborator to unlock ideas and new ways of doing things. responsibilities : able to give clear, unambiguous instruction to all other members of the lifting team and minimum 15 years’ experience in relevant field. have knowledge and understanding of when and how to escalate any matter relating to safe lifting practices or site safety in general. monitor lifting operations, ensuring that these are carried out in accordance with approved lifting procedures and lifting plans. ensuring that adequate inspection/examination and maintenance of the equipment and lifting accessories has been carried out. stop lifting operations whenever it is considered that danger is likely to arise if the operation was to continue. they are responsible for coordinating and supervising all lifting activities in accordance with regulations and is required to be present to all other members of the lifting team. ensuring that contractors prestart inspections are carried on all lifting equipment and accessories. ensuring the contractors are wearing appropriate ppe. attend daily activity briefings of the contractors. refer to lifting managers / lifting leads for further instruction if necessary. lifting supervisors roles protect the reputation of the line management team and not be detrimental in their bearing or standards both at work and in private. refer to bs7121 for further roles and responsibilities. protect the reputation of the line management name: WSP
title: Graduate Electrical Design Engineer_ Saudi National
description: we are wsp - join us and make your career future ready! think bigger scale. think higher profile. think ground-breaking. join wsp, and you’ll be at the heart of a team of international experts all dedicated to growing and sharing their expertise and working on projects that transform society for all of us. wsp middle east are currently looking for a graduate electrical design engineer_ saudi national to join our team in jeddah, ksa. your new role, what's involved? collaborate with project teams to develop electrical design concepts and solutions that meet project requirements and client expectations. perform electrical engineering calculations, analysis, and simulations to ensure design integrity and compliance with applicable codes and standards. prepare detailed electrical drawings, specifications, and technical reports for construction documentation. conduct site visits and assessments to gather relevant data and provide technical support during construction phases. coordinate with other disciplines and stakeholders to integrate electrical systems into overall project designs. stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in electrical engineering to enhance project delivery and innovation. adhere to project schedules, budgets, and quality standards while ensuring client satisfaction and project success. participate in internal and external meetings, presentations, and reviews to communicate project progress and findings effectively. we'd love to hear from you if you have: bachelor's degree in electrical engineering or a related field from an accredited institution. minimum of 02 years of experience in electrical engineering design, preferably in the building services sector. proficiency in electrical design software tools such as autocad, revit, and etap. strong knowledge of local and international electrical codes and standards (e.g., nec, iec, ieee). excellent communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills. ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively in a fast-paced environment. fluency in both written and spoken english and arabic is required. what's in it for you? what if we can have work-life balance? what if we can be rewarded in ways that support our individual needs? what if we can be accepted for who we are? here at wsp – we can! wsp recognises that work is only one part of our lives and making time for the other things in our life is important – be that our families, our friends or ourselves. so, if working from home, working part-time or having flexible start and finish time will help with this let us know as part of your application. as well as rewarding you with competitive pay, wsp offers standard benefits including first class medical cover, generous annual leave, and paid professional subscriptions. be you, be happy - we strive to have a friendly and inclusive culture which respects and maximizes the contribution individuals can bring to wsp. we recognise the benefits that people with varying backgrounds and experiences can bring. here at wsp we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of gender, race, disability, age, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy or maternity/paternity. we will interview all disabled applicants who meet the essential criteria. apply now and be the future of wsp! wsp is one of the world's leading engineering professional services consulting firms. we are dedicated to our local communities and propelled by international brainpower. we are technical experts and strategic advisors including engineers, technicians, scientists, architects, planners, surveyors and environmental specialists, as well as other design, program and construction management professionals. we design lasting solutions in the property & buildings, transportation & infrastructure, environment, industry, resources (including mining and oil & gas) and power & energy sectors as well as project delivery and strategic consulting services. job reference: wspme04100

land development division – an integrated, dynamic team of planners, designers, engineers and project managers. our large, diverse and fast-growing portfolio allows an excellent opportunity for the successful candidate to grow their career and make a meaningful contribution to some of the most exciting projects across the the middle east. about atkinsréalis created by the integration of as engineering services, nuclear, operations & maintenance and capital. news and information are available at www.atkinsrealis.com or follow us on linkedin. project manager – land development (master planning, infrastructure, landscape) job summary: we are seeking a highly qualified and experienced project manager with a strong technical background in land development (infrastructure, transport planning, landscape, sustainability) to lead and oversee large, complex projects within our organization. the ideal candidate will possess the knowledge, skills, and experience to lead multi-disciplinary land development teams and drive these projects from inception to completion. key responsibilities: project leadership: lead and manage master planning / urban design / land development projects team management: build and lead cross-functional project teams, providing guidance, mentorship, and motivation to team members to achieve project goals. client interaction: cultivate and maintain strong client relationships, understand their needs, and ensure project deliverables meet or exceed client expectations whilst aligning with project budgets project management fundamentals: cost and resource management: develop project budgets, monitor and control expenditures, and allocate resources efficiently to optimize project outcomes. risk management: identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success. scope and schedule management: develop a work breakdown structure for the project, create schedules, monitor and control project progress against schedule. ensure scope and deliverables are well-defined. ensure variance and scope creep are identified and that change is adequately documented and managed. quality management: manage and control quality on the project by implementing atkinsréalis processes and templates and instilling and maintaining a quality culture across the project teams. procurement management: apply commercial and legal acumen (with the contributions of support functions) to manage procurement activities on the project, ensuring main agreement execution, change control and supplier/subcontractor appointments. stakeholder and communication management: establish stakeholder and communication management plans. ensure communication is efficiently and accurately flowing into and out of the project, in accordance with business protocols. evaluate stakeholder power and influence and ensure relevant feedback is considered and requisite approvals sought. land development design delivery: experience project managing land development type projects within the middle east (master planning, infrastructure), leading multi-disciplinary teams design oversight: work with design managers and technical leads to oversee the design process, ensuring that urban design principles, aesthetics, and functionality are integrated effectively into project plans. sufficient technical understanding of supporting disciplines and their requirements in order to ensure a balanced and robust master plan which is suitable for progression into future project stages regulatory compliance: stay updated with relevant planning and zoning regulations, and ensure projects adhere to all legal requirements. maintain a strong understanding and ensure compliance with relevant international, regional, local planning and land development technical standards. key candidate attributes: proven experience as a project manager on land development projects within the middle east proficiency in project management tools, processes and principles knowledge and understanding of urban planning principles, land use, zoning, and architectural design. strong understanding of the full land development project life cycle and technical disciplines (visioning, master planning, detailed design, construction, handover, operations) to allow sufficient foresight to be applied at early stages to ensure designability, buildability and maintainability. experience in leading multi-disciplinary teams (master planning, transport planning, infrastructure, landscaping, architecture etc) through land development type projects. experience leading projects post-master planning stage is advantageous. technical background in a land development discipline (master planning, transport planning, infrastructure, landscaping) is preferred, in addition to a secondary technical understanding of key supporting disciplines excellent leadership and team management skills. exceptional communication and presentation abilities. familiarity with local, regional, and international design standards relevant to land development knowledge and understanding of key middle east clients and stakeholders strong problem-solving and decision-making capabilities. knowledge of sustainability and green building practices is preferable gis (geographic information system) proficiency is preferable familiarity with 3d modelling and visualization tools is preferable familiarity with publishing and graphics tools such as indesign and illustrator is preferable multilingual ability is preferable middle east experience is preferable qualifications: degree in a land development related discipline (master planning, urban design, transport planning, infrastructure, landscaping) is preferred. pmp, mapm or other similar project management accreditations preferred working conditions: this role may require travel to project sites and meetings with clients, local authorities, and stakeholders. it may also involve occasional extended working hours to meet project deadlines. rewards & benefits: we offer an excellent package which includes: a competitive salary accommodation summary technology is rapidly changing the aec sector and pwc are supporting organisations, across multiple sectors, to implement this change and unlock the benefits that a digitalized future offers. modeling (bim) on their infrastructure projects and enabling their digital transformation. in this role you will work closely with clients to support them with implementing a robust bim framework that can be leveraged throughout the asset lifecycle, and help clients to ascertain their bim goals and identify which bim uses will deliver the most value on their projects and operations. lead the implementation of bim processes across client projects, ensuring seamless integration into existing workflows. collaborate with project teams to establish bim standards and protocols tailored to each project's unique requirements. create model production delivery tables to help clients to plan the delivery. develop and implement an information requirements framework in accordance with iso 19650 developing organisational, asset and exchange information requirements. develop and implement bim execution plans defining the client and project requirements. develop the midp in coordination with the project programme and manage information management deliverables in accordance with the midp. manage bim process workflows and the coordination between project stakeholders. collaborate with project managers, architects, engineers, and other stakeholders to coordinate bim deliverables throughout the project lifecycle. facilitate interdisciplinary communication to optimize project outcome and support the adoption of a bim-centric workflow. promote technical collaboration and proactive interface management between project stakeholders. implement quality assurance processes to ensure bim models and data comply with industry standards and project requirements. conduct training sessions for client teams to enhance their bim proficiency, ensure effective utilization of bim tools and adoption of bim processes. introduce innovative solutions and technologies to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of bim implementation. specific technical requirements proficient in bim software tools such as autodesk revit, trimble connect, bentley openbuildings, solidworks navisworks, and other relevant tools. strong skill-sets in project management, construction management, facilities management, engineering, or architectural technology. excellent communication and interpersonal skills. proven history delivering digital consulting and digital transformation projects. familiarity with the concepts of digital transformation, digital twin, smart cities, and other technologies such as (iot, cloud, blockchain, and ai) and awareness of the gcc digital ecosystem. strong bim and information management experience including implementation processes defined in iso 19650 experience and understanding of infrastructure asset management i.e. iso 55000 knowledge of systems and hardware integration software implementation skills - c++, unreal, java, python, revit api (preferred but not essential). general requirements experience of working in asset intensive industries i.e. aviation, utilities, oil and gas, rail, highways able to operate and influence at multiple levels in a complex, global organisation. organised and able to drive projects from inception through to successful execution, while balancing longer term goals with near term pressures. passionate about leveraging technology and data to drive change across the construction sector. qualifications bachelor or master degree in architecture, engineering, or a related field engineering degree (bsc, msc, meng) 10+ years of consulting experience in a technology role education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified) degrees/field of study required: degrees/field of study preferred: certifications (if blank, certifications not specified) required skills optional skills desired languages (if blank, desired languages not specified) travel requirements up to 80% available for work visa sponsorship? yes government clearance required? yes job posting end date job id 509709wd

name: PricewaterhouseCoopers
title: Forensics - Data and Digital Services Senior Manager
description: forensics - data and digital services senior manager line of service advisory industry/sector not applicable specialism deals management level senior manager job description & summary a career in our deals advanced analytics practice, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients with the deal process and deliver outstanding services both pre-deal and post-deal from the perspective of mergers and acquisitions data analysis. a career in pwc's capital projects and infrastructure technology department is an opportunity to bring pwcs strategy to life by developing and delivering technology and data-powered services in one of the fastest growing sectors in the region. our clients expect us to bring the right people and the right technology to solve their biggest problems; we meet that challenge and accelerate the adoption of disruptive solutions through our integrated team of specialists. we have skilled technologists, engineers, data scientists, business analysts and industry subject matter experts who come together to innovative and deliver across the capital projects and infrastructure value chain. having a sector-focus, our projects span the technology and data spectrum. we are therefore recruiting for senior technology and data leaders who can adapt to client demands, adapt and apply themselves to the following domains: digital and data strategy and transformation digital solution ideation, conceptualization, architecting and design development of business and functional requirements and specifications development of use cases and business cases for data engineering and data science data warehousing and enterprise architecture development/implementation data management and dataops design and implementation/execution business intelligence reporting design and implementation/execution responsibilities as a senior manager, you will develop your understanding of the themes and trends in the market, with access to the key client accounts in the region. you will work collaboratively with other experts to shape the future of our clients and to bring about positive change. in particular, it will be expected that the role includes the following: oversight of technical project delivery, including work output and quality management, client management, project planning, risk management, scope management and schedule and budget management. working to mentor and train other members of the business unit and the project team in order to foster a high performance team environment. contribution to innovation and insights on each project, proposal, proposition or proof of concept through leveraging existing commercial off-the-shelf solutions and driving the development of new technology and/or analytical solutions. ownership of business development efforts (both internal and external) through building and leveraging relationships, co-developing propositions and being active in the market. management of responding to rfps, including scope and budget development, pitch preparation and pitch delivery. collaborating with colleagues in pwc's middle eastern offices on client work and internal initiatives as well as with international teams where appropriate and keeping up to date with current trends from the region and from across the world. strategizing and managing relationships with technology vendors and service providers, undertaking product evaluations and negotiating contractual terms. as a client advisor and service delivery leader, it is expected that the candidate will have excellent communication skills, stakeholder management skills, presentation skills, the ability to conceptualize and translate client needs into tangible solutions and to move easily from big picture thinking to managing relevant detail. pwc middle east operates as a regional practice and, accordingly, the candidate is expected to have the ability and willingness to travel within the region. preferred knowledge/skills: the following professional qualifications (or equivalent) would be beneficial to the candidate: dama's certified data management professional (cdmp®) pmi's certified project management professional (pmp®) professional scrum master™ (psm) certifications although the role will be focused on delivery oversight rather than performing technical delivery, it would be beneficial if the candidate had experience of performing technical delivery at some stage of their career. the following are platforms and/or skillsets that are applied within our practice and it would be beneficial if the candidate was familiar with or had a conceptual understanding of them: microsoft azure, google cloud platform, amazon web services, oracle cloud infrastructure relational databases, sql, t-sql or pl/sql data aggregators such as databricks, azure datafactory, palantir, snowflake or teradata and streaming/messaging services such as kafka data modeling and schema design and development big data platforms including hadoop, bigquery/bigtable, map/reduce nosql databases (e.g. cosmosdb, mongodb, documentdb, cloud datastore, casandra, etc.) data integration tools (ssis, informatica, api management, enterprise service bus) and rules engine (e.g biztalk) programming and scripting languages including c++, c#, java, python, r construction sector tools including autocad, primavera, ms project and understanding of bim models and aggregator tools such as ares prism. data visualisation tools including powerbi, tableau or qlikview education (if blank, degree and/or field description: company description jobs for humanity is collaborating with atkins to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. we support individuals coming from all walks of life. company name: atkins job description join us in engineering a better future for our planet and its people. atkinsréalis is a world-leading design, engineering and project management organization. we connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. together, with our industry partners and clients, and our global team of consultants, designers, engineers and project managers, we can change the world. we have a strong presence in the middle east that enables us to build deep and lasting relationships with our clients. we share their goals and long-term ambitions; organization to identify and tell inspiring stories that illustrate the exceptional work being delivered on the line at neom, how it will transform the built environment sector, and the work being delivered to lead the way on issues like sustainability, health & safety, and digitalization. reporting to the director of communications, the senior content manager will propose, draft and edit a engagement materials. as a key member of the communications team, the role holder will have ample creative autonomy, and will be a keen collaborator to unlock ideas and new ways of doing things about atkinsréalis created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, atkinsréalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. we create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. we deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. the breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as engineering services, nuclear, operations & maintenance and capital. news and information are available at www.atkinsrealis.com or follow us on linkedin. job title: the piling manager location: neom (remote) - ksa company: atkinsréalis job summary: the piling manager will be responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of piling operations within the neom project. this role requires a seasoned professional with extensive experience in geotechnical engineering, foundation construction, and project management. the ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successfully delivering piling projects within budget and on schedule. key responsibilities: project planning and coordination: develop comprehensive project plans for piling operations, considering project scope, timelines, and resource requirements. coordinate with the project management team to integrate piling activities into the overall construction schedule. technical expertise: provide technical expertise in geotechnical engineering and foundation construction to ensure the successful execution of piling activities. review and approve piling designs, ensuring compliance with industry standards and project specifications. resource management: manage and allocate resources effectively, including personnel, equipment, and materials, to ensure optimal project performance. collaborate with procurement teams to source high-quality materials and equipment for piling operations. quality assurance and compliance: implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure that piling activities meet or exceed industry standards. ensure compliance with safety regulations and company policies, fostering a culture of safety on the construction site. team leadership: lead and motivate a team of piling engineers, supervisors, and operators to achieve project goals. provide guidance and support to team members, fostering professional development and continuous improvement. client communication: establish and maintain strong relationships with clients, addressing concerns, and providing regular project updates. collaborate with stakeholders to address any changes or modifications to the piling scope of work. reporting and documentation: prepare regular progress reports and documentation for internal and external stakeholders. maintain accurate records of project activities, including daily reports, resource utilization, and any issues encountered. qualifications and experience: bachelor's degree in civil engineering or a related field. proven experience 20 years in managing piling operations on large-scale construction projects. strong knowledge of geotechnical engineering principles and foundation construction techniques. excellent project management skills, including planning, scheduling, and resource allocation. familiarity with relevant industry standards, codes, and regulations. leadership and team management skills. effective communication and interpersonal skills. ability to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment. atkins réalis is committed to eliminating discrimination and encouraging diversity amongst our workforce. we aim to provide quality and fairness for all job applicants and employees and not to discriminate on grounds of gender, marital status, age, race, ethnic origin, religious conviction or disablement. we oppose all forms of unlawful treatment and discrimination. our aim is for the company to be representative of all sections of society and that each employee feels respected and able to give their best. we are committed to a policy of treating all our employees and job applications equally. we pursue this commitment by: having clear and concise procedures and guidelines for both line managers and employees to ensure policies are fully understood and implemented; complying with the relevant employment legislation and codes of practice; ensuring that all existing employees, potential employees, colleagues and customers are treated equally and with respect; ensuring that the workplace is an environment free from discrimination, harassment, victimisation and bullying regardless of an individual’s gender, marital status, age, race, ethnic origin, religious conviction or disablement; making all decisions relating to recruitment, selection or promotion according to the employees’ ability. why choose atkinsréalis your difference makes a difference. we care for our people and are committed to creating an inclusive working environment where you can thrive and build a future you want to be a part of. thrive with us. when you join us, your wellbeing, health and safety become our top priority. engineering the future with digital. from design and engineering to project management, digital is fundamental to our way of working. champion lasting change. we build sustainability into everything we do.

description: job description: principal objective: a brief summary of the responsibilities of the position senior supervisory field engineering level in construction methodology and management and application of engineering techniques on large, multiple or complex major infrastructure, roads and utility projects. responsible for managing the administration of the construction projects, and supervising field construction monitoring activities and providing technical guidance and expertise to ensure completion within established budget and schedule, in accordance with design during work activities. provide guidance to contractors regarding schedule, procedures, the scope of work and other information requirements. plan and organize monitoring of contractor’s activities. review activities of subordinates to ensure field operations are adequately monitored and all necessary tests and inspections are conducted. assist in preparing manpower forecasts to ensure adequate staffing for monitoring activities. develop a close working relationship with the contractor. provide technical guidance in the interpretation of specifications. review job plans, methods, equipment, staffing and productivity and detect potential problems in conforming to established schedules or specifications. review problems with the contractor to determine whether actions proposed are adequate for resolution. review shop and as-built drawings submitted by the contractor. obtain engineering review and approval. identify and report on discrepancies in original design or in contract documents that necessitate contract modifications. review submitted construction, quality assurance and other procedures, and obtain necessary approvals. coordinate with other departments to obtain required support. coordinate and interface between contractors and project management staff where project impacts on other projects. resolve conflicts in schedules and coordinate tie-ins of facilities where applicable. recommend approval of schedule changes in the sequence of construction activities where required. compile technical data to prepare weekly and monthly reports on project progress, cost and quality control. conduct or direct fact finding investigations and advise srcm of problems in meeting schedules or specifications. assist srcm in administration functions and initiate correspondence to contractors and other departments for srcm’s signature. assume responsibilities of srcm in periods of absence. review and verify that items submitted for billing on work estimates are justified and confirm actual performance. determine the percentage of work completed and recommend payment of work estimates as appropriate. advise contractor when not acceptable or of necessary corrective action or additional documentation required. assist in coordinating the compilation of relevant documentation and the determination of actual events and situations causing contract delays and/or claims and in evaluating the validity of claims. experience and qualifications: list the background experience required for the position, number of years’ experience, in what fields. describe the desirable academic background. bachelor’s degree in civil engineering from a western universiwith 12 years of construction supervision experience in civil and utilities work type of projects. at least 5 years of experience in the supervision field of construction management. working knowledge of multi-craft construction practices. pmp certification is desirable and us professional engineer registration is preferred. must be fluent and able to effectively communicate in both spoken and written english language. knowledge of computers and basic software applications: ms office (word, excel, power point), name: Jacobs Engineering Group Inc.
title: Site Lead Cost Controller
description: your impact: our people & places solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. from facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow. start your jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. what if we showed you how we're solving the world’s greatest challenges by transforming intangible ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world? our people & places solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society, as a whole. from facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow. at jacobs, we challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. if you’re interested in a long and rewarding career working with the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then jacobs is where you belong. we are looking for a driven cost control expert to manage and control project costs, forecasting, and reporting on all cost-related aspects of energy and power projects on site. this role involves close collaboration with project managers, site teams, and other stakeholders to ensure projects are delivered within budgetary constraints while maintaining high-quality standards. general responsibilities include: monitor and control project costs, including labor, materials, equipment, subcontractors, and other expenses. develop and maintain detailed cost reports, forecasts, and budgets for assigned projects. analyze cost variances and trends, identify potential cost overruns, and recommend corrective actions. implement cost control measures and strategies to ensure projects stay within approved budgets. prepare and present comprehensive cost reports, including cash flow projections, earned value analysis, and cost-to-complete estimates. analyze historical cost data and project trends to identify opportunities for cost optimization and process improvements. collaborate with project managers and site teams to provide accurate and timely cost information for decision-making. review and analyze contracts, purchase orders, and change orders for cost implications. negotiate and manage change orders, claims, and contract variations with clients, vendors, and subcontractors. provide training and guidance to team members on cost control processes, tools, and best practices. liaise with project stakeholders, including client representatives, contractors, and suppliers, to ensure alignment on cost management strategies. here’s what you’ll need: about you: minimum requirements shall be a professional engineer (preferably in engineering/construction manager, finance, or related field) with at least 10 years of experience within the energy and power industry. strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex financial data. proficiency in cost control software and tools (e.g., primavera p6, ms project, excel). strong attention to detail and accuracy in financial reporting and documentation. knowledge of energy and power project lifecycles, construction methodologies, and industry-specific regulations. experience in working in saudi arabia and in the middle east is preferred. ability to analyze all relevant project-related information and communicate project status and major issues in writing or verbally. proactive communicator who can utilize the wider skills within an organization to provide effective solutions to key client issues at short notice. jacobs. a world where you can. from our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions – we’re committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. joining jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. we collaborate and share! by supporting one another, we all succeed. with safety and flexibility always top of mind, we’ve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. you’ll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too – from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. no matter what drives you, you’ll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals – all at a single global company. start your jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow. please note: if you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to jacobs

name: Al-Futtaim
title: Head of Planning
description: established in the 1930s as a trading business, al-futtaim group today is one of the most diversified and progressive, privately held regional businesses headquartered in dubai, united arab emirates. structured into five operating divisions; automotive, financial services, real estate, retail and healthcare; employing more than 35,000 employees across more than 20 countries in the middle east, asia and africa, al-futtaim group partners with over 200 of the world's most admired and innovative brands. al-futtaim group’s entrepreneurship and relentless customer focus enables the organization to continue to grow and expand; responding to the changing needs of our customers within the societies in which we operate. by upholding our values of respect, excellence, collaboration and integrity; al-futtaim group continues to enrich the lives and aspirations of our customers each and every day overview of the role: responsible for managing and control of all planning engineers at various projects to enable them developing, tracking and guiding the most appropriate method and sequence of mep activities in conjunction with the contract requirements and main contract programme in order to ensure the project is completed timely and on budget. ensure that planning engineers at various projects are providing the proper service to the projects managers. generating weekly and monthly high level reports to management indicating risks and concerns at early stage. responsible for all claims including prolongation, acceleration, disruption .. etc. maximize utilization of planning resources to serve multiple projects by sharing the work load what you will do: support planning engineers in developing and obtaining approval of mep contract baseline programme. monitor progress of engineering tasks, including preparing engineering registers and highlighting variances. coordinate procurement activities, ensuring timely deliverables and compliance with project requirements. monitor work progress, update baseline schedule, and prepare progress reports. organize weekly meetings with project team and specialist subcontractors. identify manpower requirements and monitor labor productivity. develop testing & commissioning schedule in line with baseline programme. identify variations impacting the programme and delay events. notify delays in accordance with contract conditions. prepare delay analysis impact programme required skills to be successful: minimum experience: 15 years of experience in planning of mep projects. job-specific skills: strong familiarity with project management software, such as primavera (p6-v6) knowledge of contracts (fidic) strong knowledge of delay analysis excellent communication & letter writing skills interpersonal skill, ethical values and commitment to continual improvement what equips you for the role: minimum qualifications , certification and knowledge: be/ btech – mechanical/ electrical. primavera (p6) about al-futtaim engineering & technologies al-futtaim engineering & technologies offers customers complete engineering and systems integration solutions. the engineering arm operates in the uae, qatar, saudi arabia and egypt providing a wide variety of products and services from air conditioning, scaffolding and access solutions, elevators and escalators, control and life safety, facilities management, building products, mep, energy management, technology infrastructure and digital transformation. the technologies division provides complete business solutions to large, medium and small customers that include, contact centre solutions, business applications, business intelligence, data management, advanced analytics amongst others. the it infrastructure portfolio comprises ip telephony, elv systems, networking solutions, professional audio-visual solutions and managed services. these solutions are further complemented by services that include project management, installation, testing, commissioning and after-sales maintenance contracts.

name: King Abdullah University of Science and Technology
title: Assistant Professor in Marine Systems Modeling
description: assistant professor in marine systems modeling employer king abdullah university of science and technology location saudi arabia (sa) salary kaust offers internationally competitive salaries and attractive benefits. closing date 6 jul 2024 discipline environmental science job type faculty member employment - hours full time duration fixed term qualification phd sector academia you need to sign in or create an account to a job. position description: as part of a major initiative to strengthen its research in marine science, the marine science program (mars) in the biological and environmental science and engineering (bese) division at kaust is seeking to expand research, higher education and innovations in the field of marine data modelling and integration. applications for a faculty position at the rank of: assistant professor are invited from highly competitive candidates eager to pursue innovative research addressing fundamental questions and developing cutting–edge technologies for application in marine systems. this position offers a unique opportunity to leverage kaust’s unparalleled access to the red sea, serving as a catalyst for research that uses computational approaches to integrate biological, physical, and chemical data within a cohesive framework to study marine diversity and function. besides establishing a world-class research program, the successful candidate is expected to start a strong teaching program in marine systems modeling and to develop multidisciplinary collaborations within the mars program and the bese, and across divisions, research centers and initiatives at kaust. key responsibilities: drive forward-thinking research to address fundamental marine science questions, employing bioinformatics and advanced computational techniques to describe interactions, connectivity and/or functional traits within and across marine holobionts and/or ecosystems spearhead the development and application of quantitative models for organismal or systemic networks, across a spectrum of marine life, that can include, for example, microbiomes, plants, benthic and pelagic organisms, and ecosystems commit to offer a standout graduate course in marine data science foster interdisciplinary collaboration within the mars program and the bese division, extending partnerships across kaust’s various divisions, strategic initiatives in the kingdom of saudi arabia and international peer qualifications: ph.d. in bioinformatics, data science, marine science, microbiology, environmental science, or a closely related field a strong publication record in relevant scientific journals demonstrated ability to secure external research funding experience in developing quantitative models for organisms or ecosystems excellent communication and collaboration skills teaching and supervisory experience at the graduate student level (preferred) experience with red sea marine organisms or ecosystems about kaust kaust is an international, graduate research university dedicated to advancing science and technology through interdisciplinary research, education, and innovation. kaust attracts top international faculty, scientists, engineers and students to conduct curiosity-driven and goal-oriented research to address the world’s most pressing scientific and technological challenges. located in saudi arabia, on the eastern shores of the red sea, kaust provides an award-winning campus to live, work, study and play, and offers superb research facilities, with guaranteed baseline research funding, infrastructure support, entrepreneurship opportunities and internationally competitive salaries. for more information about kaust, please visit http://www.kaust.edu.sa. more information about the bese division and the marine science program is available at http://bese.kaust.edu.sa. application instructions: interested candidates should upload the following materials: a cover letter up-to-date curriculum vitae including a full publication list statement of research interests (5 pages maximum) statement of teaching philosophy and an outline of 1-2 graduate planned teaching course(s) names and contact information of 4 to 5 referees. referees must be acknowledged experts in the field and predominantly from academia copies of most relevant publications (maximum of five) applications will be considered as they are received. the position will remain open until filled. kaust is an equal-opportunity employer, committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive academic community. we welcome applications from all qualified individuals, including women, minorities, and individuals with disabilities.

name: Shine Event Staffing
title: Integration Engineer
description: join our dynamic team as an integration engineer are you passionate about technology and innovation? do you thrive in an environment where you can engineer seamless solutions for complex systems? our dynamic team is on the lookout for a skilled integration engineer to play a pivotal role in facilitating the smooth integration of our software systems to ensure a seamless eco system. this is your chance to become a key player in the execution of high-profile projects within one of the industry's leading companies. about the role as an integration engineer, you will be at the forefront of our operations, ensuring that different systems, applications, and third-party services are flawlessly integrated to meet our business needs. your expertise will drive the success of our projects, enhancing efficiency, scalability, and performance across all platforms. key responsibilities evaluate current software systems and identify opportunities for integration and automation design and develop api-based integrations between our core systems and third-party modules write custom python scripts to facilitate data exchange, transformation, and process orchestration collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (e.g., business analysts, developers, it operations) to understand requirements and define integration strategies establish data mapping, validation, and error handling protocols to ensure data integrity across integrated systems document integration workflows, processes, and technical specifications for knowledge transfer and future maintenance monitor integrated system performance, identify bottlenecks, and optimize workflows for efficiency serve as the primary technical liaison with our software vendors and integration partners provide training and support to end-users on integrated system functionality what we're looking for a problem-solver with a keen eye for detail and a strong understanding of integration patterns and principles. proven experience in system integration, api design, and middleware technologies. proficient in programming languages such as java, python, or equivalent. excellent communication skills, with the ability to interface effectively between technical teams and stakeholders. a strong desire to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment. why join us? working with us means being part of an organization that values innovation, teamwork, and delivering exceptional solutions. we offer: competitive salary and benefits package. opportunities for professional growth and development. a collaborative, inclusive, and supportive work environment. access to cutting-edge technology and tools. how to apply if you are driven by innovation, technical challenges, and making a real impact, we would love to hear from you. to apply for the integration engineer position, please submit your resume and outline your relevant experience and why you're the perfect fit for our team. join us in shaping the future through seamless integration solutions.

name: Rawabi Holding Co.
title: Well Test Operator I
description: rawabi cetco company dammam, saudi arabia posted 3 days ago unlimited job description job summary: the well test operator i is responsible for conducting well tests to evaluate the performance of oil and gas wells. this role involves setting up and operating test equipment, collecting well data, and ensuring tests are conducted safely and accurately. job responsibility: set up and operate well test equipment in accordance with company procedures and safety guidelines. collect and record data from well tests, including pressure, flow rates, and temperature readings. monitor well performance during tests and troubleshoot any issues that may arise. communicate test results to engineers and other team members for analysis and decision-making. maintain accurate records of well tests and equipment maintenance. skills candidate requirements: high school diploma or equivalent; technical or vocational training in oil and gas operations is a plus. previous experience as a well test operator or similar role in the oil and gas industry. knowledge of well testing equipment, procedures, and safety protocols. strong attention to detail and ability to accurately collect and record data. good communication skills and ability to work effectively in a team environment. education technical job details job location dammam, saudi arabia company industry other business support services company type employer (private sector) job role other joining date 2024-05-19 employment status remote job number of vacancies 2 preferred candidate career level entry level years of experience min: 2 max: 3 degree diploma job details job location dammam, saudi arabia company industry other business support services company type employer (private sector) job role other joining date 2024-05-19 employment status remote job number of vacancies 2
