name: HMH
title: Senior Manager Facility & Plant
description: about us hmh is a leading provider of drilling solutions, offering a wide range of products and services that are designed to be the safest and most efficient in the industry. apart from our expertise in land and offshore operations, we are continuously expanding our knowledge within subsea mining, geothermal, onshore and offshore construction, as well as offshore wind industries. with offices in 16 countries across five continents, hmh maintains a strong global presence. hmh is a frontrunner in developing and providing automation and digital solutions for our drilling customers to support their endeavor to improve efficiency and environmental footprint. equipped with its brilliant team of engineers, hmh is committed to actively exploring opportunities in other industries. for us, this means new opportunities and challenges that we need creativity and great minds to solve in our efforts to innovate our future. do you want to join our team? at hmh we value our employees. we offer exciting job opportunities that will give you the opportunity to grow in your role and give you the professional development you deserve. in addition to competitive pay and benefits, you will join a casual and inclusive work environment. our environment is based on respect and having a good day at work, so you can expect to join a knowledgeable, global team who help each other to succeed. role summary: the senior facility/ plant manager is responsible for the daily management and coordination of plant operations including production, pre-production, operations, and logistics. this is a hands-on position that is responsible for the development of policies and procedures designed to increase productivity, assure quality, and mitigate label production problems. the senior plant manager will improve throughout and other in-house processes with the objective of reducing overall costs and enhancing customer satisfaction. the senior plant manager will provide direction to subordinate managers, offering professional expertise and monitoring performance to ensure that departmental and individual objectives are achieved within scheduled timelines and budgets. this position also will be tasked with establishing and maintaining a safe, legally compliant workplace, and enforcing compliance with all corporate policies and procedures. essential responsibilities: manage and supervise staff, preparing work schedules and assigning specific duties. oversee and direct the activities of subordinate managers and non-management staff. determine staffing requirements and oversee the interview, hiring and training of new employees with the assistance of the human resources department. ensure that all staff receives appropriate training on job duties, corporate policies and applicable regulations. ensure compliance with company policy, procedures and applicable regulations. provide coaching and mentoring and conduct evaluations of all subordinate managers within the department. review financial statements, activity reports, and other performance data to measure productivity and goal achievement and to determine areas needing cost reduction and program improvement. establish and implement departmental policies, goals, objectives and procedures, conferring with the executive members, management team and staff as necessary. understand, implement and enforce the safety program. monitor third party business and suppliers to ensure that they efficiently and effectively provide the needed services and supplies while staying within budgetary limits. oversee activities directly related to the manufacture and supply. monitor departmental performance against goals to ensure that progress is made and to take corrective action if necessary. manage the movement of finished products and materials in and out of the facility. protect the organization's value by keeping information confidential. always maintain professionalism, tact, diplomacy, and sensitivity to portray the company in a positive manner. maintain a sustainable relationship with other departmental managers. ensure that emergency as well as health and safety equipment is tested and replenished on a regular basis. meet regularly with department heads/business unit leaders; facilitate resolution of issues/problems between business units and/or departments. plan, organize, direct and run optimum day-to-day operations to exceed our customers’ expectations. increase production, assets capacity and flexibility while minimizing unnecessary costs and maintaining current quality standards be responsible for production output, product quality and on-time shipping allocate resources effectively and fully utilize assets to produce optimal results implement strategies in alignment with strategic initiatives and provide a clear sense of direction and focus. collect and analyze data to find places of waste or overtime. develop systems and processes that track and optimize productivity and standards, metrics and performance targets to ensure effective return on assets. stay up to date with latest production management best practices and concepts. qualifications/requirements: bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college. 10+ years of experience in plant management. strong oral and written communication skills. strong interpersonal and leadership skills. demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems. demonstrated ability to lead programs/projects. ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs. established project management skills. proven work experience as a plant manager & managerial experience proven record for performance with set goals. judgment and decision-making skills with the ability to consider the relative costs and benefits of potential actions and to choose the appropriate path. ability to identify measures of performance and actions needed to improve or correct performance. ability to delegate, set expectations and monitor progress of all direct reports. motivate, inspire, provide and accept feedback to and from employees. possess prioritization skills necessary to use time effectively and set action plans to achieve business targets. strong organizational and time management skills ability to manage multiple projects and stay on schedule in a fast-paced environment ability to create accountability and to lead by example strong team building, decision-making and people management skills desired characteristics: 10+ years manufacturing plant experience in the oil service. bs/technical degree in a technical/production or business management discipline proven track record in operation management good project management skills, strategic thinking as well as experience in leading and working with interdisciplinary teams being open-minded and challenging the status quo adequate knowledge of business and management principles (budgeting, strategic planning, resource allocation and human resources) be knowledgeable of safety, quality, productivity, demand creation, inventory and stewardship processes. familiarity with regulatory requirements for operating plants

and overall customer experience. productivity optimization: develop and implement initiatives to improve productivity in nli case management, focusing on streamlining processes, reducing response times, and enhancing overall efficiency. cost efficiency: identify opportunities for cost savings and efficiencies in nli management processes. collaborate with suppliers to negotiate favorable terms while ensuring the highest quality of work. quality assurance: ensure that work performed by suppliers meets rigorous quality standards. monitor and evaluate the quality of work delivered and implement corrective actions as necessary. dashboard development: create and maintain a comprehensive performance dashboard to measure key metrics, track progress, and identify areas for improvement in nli case management and related processes. process improvement: continuously analyze nli management workflows, identifying bottlenecks and areas for enhancement. propose and implement process improvements to drive greater effectiveness and efficiency. fmi process support: assist the team in managing the field modification instruction (fmi) process, collaborating with internal stakeholders to accurately identify and source materials required in the field. nli field engineer support: provide timely and expert support to nli field engineers when faced with complex challenges or requirements in the field, contributing to effective problem-solving and ensuring seamless operations. master planning: master planning and follow up of preventive maintenance (pm), field modification instruction (fmi), installation, option & upgrades (o&u), helium refill operations. qualifications and skills: bachelor’s degree in, engineering, supply chain management, or a related field (or equivalent work experience). proven experience in vendor management, procurement, or supply chain roles, with a focus on non-listed items. strong negotiation and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain productive relationships with suppliers and internal teams. analytical mindset with the ability to leverage data to drive decision-making and process improvements. proficiency in creating and utilizing performance dashboards and metrics to measure and enhance performance. exceptional problem-solving abilities and the capacity to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. familiarity with field modification instruction (fmi) processes is a plus. detail-oriented with a commitment to maintaining high-quality standards. strong organizational skills and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. proficiency in relevant software applications (e.g., microsoft office suite, data analysis tools). willingness to adapt to changing priorities and business needs. preferred qualifications: green belt / black belt certified or familiar with six sigma quality concepts and tools knowledge of iso 13485 and ce mark requirements additional information relocation assistance provided: no

name: GE Digital
title: Enterprise Architect
description: job description summary job description ge digital grid software partners with electric grid utilities to deliver mission critical monitoring, analysis, and control system software worldwide and is seeking an enterprise solution architect that will serve as a chief technologist advisor to our prospects and customers. seeking stellar interpersonal communicator ready to help our prospects and customers understand our robust power system management offerings. responsible for external facing consultation on highly complex software opportunities that require in-depth domain knowledge or two or more specialized architecture areas. pursues activities and processes that help the sales organization achieve business objectives. high levels of commercial judgment are required to achieve outcomes required. requires specialized knowledge in t&d product lines, markets, sales processes, and customer groups. requires strong commercial awareness and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory. at the enterprise solution architect you will work with business stakeholders, technology leadership, and other architects to drive holistic technology implementation across value streams (i.e., a sets products, solutions, and services that deliver value to the customer) and enablers (i.e., the activities needed to provide future business functionality, including infrastructure, security, and compliance activities). you will rely on continuous feedback that fosters adaptive design and engineering practices, and drives collaboration between programs and teams around a common vision across each architectural domain (functional, application, data, infrastructure). you will develops end-to-end architecture approach, including strategy and vision, guiding principles, and standards, incorporating technology trends and business imperatives into the future state design. you will ensure that common architecture decisions are implemented consistently in order to support the business, ot and it strategy. guides solution and domain architects across the organization on industry-leading practices, ensuring solutions align with enterprise architecture standards. this role will: lead and coordinate the domain technical and business discussions relative to future architecture direction across the gridos product portfolio or product lines including ecosystem. engage with functional c-suite and senior leaders in both it and ot analyze design and develop a roadmap and implementation plan based upon a current vs. future state in a cohesive architecture viewpoint. review and/or analyze and develop architectural requirements at domain level within product portfolio or team. participate in the enterprise architecture domain governance model. contribute to the development of software and data delivery platforms with reusable components that can be orchestrated together into different methods. lead the research and evaluation of emerging technology, industry, and market trends to assist in project development and/or operational support activities. analyzes industry and market technology trends to inform and drive the organization's strategy and goals. leads, supports, and informs overall architecture approach, guiding principles, and standards on cross-organization initiatives. offers insight and research on innovative solutions and technology strategy. defines conceptual and logical architecture specifications in line with the enterprise standards for a particular portfolio of work. understands and communicates strategic themes (e.g., differentiating business objectives that connect a portfolio to the strategy of the enterprise) and other key business drivers for architecture to solution and domain architects and other non-technical stakeholders. drives architectural initiatives and develops architectural frameworks to enable the development, operations, maintenance, and enhancement of technology. works across value streams and enablers (i.e., an organizational construct for an end-to-end process that delivers value to the organization and its customers, in which reside groups and teams which deliver products and capabilities) to harmonize architecture and ensure the appropriate flow of information and data. ensures architecture decisions are consistent across the enterprise and leverage opportunities for common approaches. leads related architects to ensure alignment across value streams. maintains high-level, holistic vision of enterprise solutions and development initiatives and related reference models. engages with business stakeholders to innovate and improve business capabilities and to design enterprise technology solutions on a strong, resilient, digitally decoupled, and scalable architectural foundation. manages relationships with leadership, solution and domain architects, and engineers to ensure enterprise architecture principles are understood for broad adoption. operates with an agile mindset, modeling agility in leadership to encourage iterative delivery with a focus on business value. provides an expert-level technical perspective during roadmap and quarterly planning to drive the alignment of epics (i.e., a significant solution development initiative within a portfolio) to the overall strategic direction of the technology organization. technical leadership – demonstrates strong technical expertise across multiple technology domains, including deep technical specialty in one or more of the following areas: applications – adms, aems, vi, ai/ml, gis, mobile…, application platforms, software engineering, enterprise information management, collaboration, integration and interoperability, systems management, endpoint devices, network, security, cloud advanced technology trends - demonstrates a strong understanding of emerging trends in the technology landscape, including new technologies, processes, and ways of working. able to determine the impact of technological advancement on the company's systems, applications, infrastructure, and practices. advanced enterprise architecture strategy - strong ability to translate business strategy into objectives for technology; capability to create a holistic enterprise architecture (application, data, and technical) that enables capabilities aligned to business goals. advanced enterprise architecture - strong understanding of the end-to-end value chain of the organization, and ability to articulate the current grid landscape and how gridos builds the foundational platform to orchestrate the grid of the future knowledge and understanding of cloud platforms such as aws, azure, or google cloud. advanced communication for technical leadership - ability to communicate technical ideas and strategies effectively to non-technical audiences, including executive leadership, via multiple mediums (e.g., written communications, verbal communications, presentations, etc.) stakeholder management - ability to create and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders in order to drive outcomes and create alignment around a vision or course of action. business functional knowledge - knowledge and understanding of the business context, market and operational functions of the operating company, and the wider utilities industry. cross-functional collaboration - ability to participate in co-operative working relationships including knowledge sharing and partnership in achieving solutions within and across business or operational functions. intermediate required qualifications bachelor’s degree in computer science or “stem” majors (science, technology, engineering and math) or 10 years industry experience a solid background and understanding of electrical power systems and utility operations is required. experience providing thought leadership to an organization. must be willing to travel 35-50% desired: 10 years - progressive experience in software engineering, technology design, and/or it architecture across multiple products, systems, and/or platforms. must include experience in at least 2 it disciplines, such as solution design, enterprise applications, product lifecycle management (plm), middle-tier services, database management, storage, distributed computing, virtualization and/or application technology. experience delivering in devops environments, including experience with continuous integration / continuous delivery (ci/cd) pipelines and agile practices is preferred. additional information relocation assistance provided: no #li-remote - this is a remote position

name: GCL Technology
title: Procurement Engineer
description: the role according to the procurement plan and departmental division of labor, docking technical specifications or technical parameter requirements with the equipment department/engineering department/production department/integrated management department, and preparing all kinds of bidding/quotation documents, budgets and bid evaluation rules and other pre-bidding information; • participate in the technical department and the supplier's pre-communication, according to the need to develop supplementary suppliers; • organize supplier inspection, organize the preparation of supplier inspection report and scoring sheet; urge the new suppliers in charge of the registration procedures for the database; • participate in pre-bid information evaluation meeting, according to the bidding documents on supplier qualifications and performance requirements, review the list of invited bidding units, submit bidding applications (confidential ec, non-confidential sap); • participate in the bidding, act as a business evaluation committee, write the business evaluation report and the price reasonableness analysis part of the comprehensive bid evaluation report, and write the finalization report; • drafting the contract text after finalizing the bid, confirming the contract terms with suppliers, applying for printing and mailing the contract; • establish the procurement work account, responsible for reminding the delivery, invoice receipts timely transfer to the contract administrator; • participate in the acceptance of equipment, coordinate and deal with all kinds of problems in the acceptance process; • to handle the entry of system data related to this post, to ensure accuracy and timeliness; to complete other matters assigned by the leadership. requirements bachelor's degree or above, majoring in equipment or related technology, business administration, economics or other related fields. • more than three years' experience in material procurement, familiar with the main technical parameters, cost components, price reasonableness analysis of the procured materials, rich experience in contract negotiation and signing, and preferably with all kinds of local supplier resources. • good coordination and communication skills. • good teamwork ability. • with fluent english communication skills, ability of speaking chinese is preferred. about the company gcl technology holdings limited (gcl tech for short, formerly known as gcl-poly energy holdings limited) was founded in hong kong in 2006, listed in november 2007 (stock code: 3800. hk), included in the hang seng composite index and the hsml 100 index in 2010, and put on the forbes global 2000 list in may 2012. the company is headquartered in suzhou and has subsidiaries and r&d centers in several locations around the world, including the united states, hong kong, xuzhou, leshan, baotou, hohhot, and zhongwei. with focus on green development, and keep improving the living environment as its mission, gcl technology is a globally leading developer and manufacturer of high-efficiency pv materials. it has a firm hold on the direction of technological development of high-efficiency pv materials, consistently maintaining its position as a trailblazer in the areas of polysilicon products. since being founded, gcl technology has been market-oriented and professional and has strong r&d power. the firstly developed modified siemens process (gcl method) massive-scale polysilicon production process has won a china patent award. its silane-based fluidized-bed-reactor (fbr) technology is protected with proprietary intellectual property rights. it also has won the first carbon footprint certificate in the field of photovoltaic raw materials in china and france, setting the lowest carbon footprint record of silicon materials at home and abroad. gcl technology regards talents as the first resource of the enterprise, its scientific research team has the most outstanding photovoltaic experts and scholars, and has formed a three-level technical talent echelon, including chinese and foreign experts as technology leaders, young scholars with profound overseas research backgrounds as the backbone, and ph.d. and master graduates from famous universities as a reserve force. our patents and authorized patents cover each major polysilicon production process, forming a complete system of intellectual property protection. at the same time, we have intelligent zero carbon production plants and are exploring industry 4.0 production modes. gcl tech subsidiary jiangsu zhongneng has won honors and titles such as national youth civilization, national new high-tech enterprise and new-energy industry base with special features for chinas torch program. gcl technology has actively responded to the national strategy of "carbon peak and carbon neutralization", and has always paid attention to energy technology innovation, energy conservation, and emission reduction, to drive the upgrading of the photovoltaic industry. in the future, in the photovoltaic industry that has experienced scientific and technological progress, industrial upgrading, and market restructuring, gcl technology will embrace a new era of energy revolution with a more innovative and assertive attitude. at the current stage, gcl is vigorously developing international projects. saudi arabia project, as gcl's first overseas large-scale chemical project, contributes to facilitating polysilicon production, we sincerely welcome management, chemical, and construction talents to join.

name: Fortanix
title: Sales Engineer - Middle East
description: the company fortanix® is a data-first multi cloud security company solving the challenges of cloud security and privacy. data is the most precious digital asset of businesses, but this data is spread across clouds, saas, applications, storage systems, and data centers. security teams struggle to track, much less secure it. fortanix empowers customers to secure all this data with a centralized solution. its pioneering confidential computing technology means data remains protected at-rest, in-motion, and in-use, keeping it secure from even the most sophisticated attacks. we are looking for an experienced sales engineer responsible for selling into new prospects as well as farming back into existing customers for high renewals and to keep customer satisfaction levels at all-time high. successful candidates will have at least 7 years of experience as an enterprise sales engineer with infrastructure, cloud, or security vendors, and would be accountable for revenue goals driven by innovative technical programs and day-to-day customer-facing account-level activities. ideal candidates also are driven by success, are highly energetic with strong hands-on skills, and embody the “can-do” attitude. this critical role will have close interactions primarily with sales, and will extend to product management, customer success, engineering, as well as external stakeholders such as customers and partners. you will: you will be part of the fortanix sales engineering organization focused on the following outcomes: drive revenue goals through close alignment to company’s revenue targets: evangelize fortanix products to prospects, customers and partners via presentations and demonstrations work closely with prospects early in the sales process to gain deep understanding of their technical requirements and propose how best to address them through the unique fortanix solution / portfolio provide technical leadership in the analysis, design and development of a fully integrated technology solution for prospects and existing customers based on their business challenges respond to functional and technical requirements in rfis/rfps successfully lead, manage and execute technical proof-of-concepts (pocs), on-premises or via remotely deliver technical training and/or conduct technical workshops for prospects, customers and partners understand and document market feedback to guide new product enhancements / features: “be the voice” of the customer to fortanix internal stakeholders on technical enhancements / new features liaise with product management, customer success, engineering and marketing to provider consultative technical expertise based on customer’s requirements customer service respond to and liaise with customer success teams to manage any customer related technical issues discover potential up-sell opportunities from new requirements / business challenges through regular feedback sessions with customer requirements proven work experience of 7+ years as a sales engineer experience selling and implementing enterprise software, security platforms, cloud platforms (iaas/paas), or virtual infrastructure track record in selling into enterprises, including $1m+ deals and or selling to global 500 / financial services companies familiar with various operating systems (windows/linux) familiar with at least one programming or scripting language (e.g. c/c++, python, perl, golang, rust, shell scripting) domain expertise in it operations with one or more of the following systems: virtualization (vmware, hyper-v, kvm) cloud service providers (aws, azure, gcp) microservices (docker, kubernetes, openshift) databases (oracle, mongodb, mysql, microsoft sql, db2, informix) storage (netapp, hds, dell/emc) backup and recovery (commvault, veritas, cohesity, rubrik) ability to forge strong, long-lasting relationships with “technical champions” ability to navigate, organize and analyze any sales-level obstacles using creative and adaptive techniques excellent written and oral communications skills in arabic and english excellent communication skills with peers and non-technical people. comfortable in conducting technical and business presentations to small and larger groups of audience comfortable conducting the business meetings with cxo level audience comfortable working for a dynamic technical organization with a fast-growing customer base previous experience working for a dynamic and young organization is a plus experience working with data security solutions is a plus expertise in various “crypto” interfaces (pkcs#11, capi, cng, jce, kmip, etc…) is highly regarded, but not mandatory experience or knowledge in confidential computing is highly regarded, but not mandatory you are currently resident in riyadh and legally entitled to work.

name: Forcepoint
title: Sales Engineer
description: who is forcepoint? forcepoint simplifies security for global businesses and governments. forcepoint’s all-in-one, truly cloud-native platform makes it easy to adopt zero trust and prevent the theft or loss of sensitive data and intellectual property no matter where people are working. 20+ years in business. 2.7k employees. 150 countries. 11k+ customers. 300+ patents. if our mission excites you, you’re in the right place; we want you to bring your own energy to help us create a safer world. all we’re missing is you! forcepoint has a fantastic opportunity to join our team in the kingdom of saudi arabia. forcepoint is looking for an experienced sales engineer with a track record of success to join our sales engineering team. we are seeking talented sales engineers who have a passion for helping customers solve hard problems, experience selling information security and analytics solutions, and who have hands on experience with enterprise solutions in large scale computer networks. this role will be the primary customer-facing technical member of the sales team but also crosses functions with product management, product operations, engineering, and marketing in addition to being responsible for the success of customer pilots and technical evaluations to demonstrate the business value of forcepoint’s cloud, network and data security products. from a technology perspective we are looking for someone with a data protection, cloud and network security background, with experience on positioning security products on enterprise customers. like the industry and our customers, we are transitioning from network and data security products to a “data-first” sase architecture. not all companies are moving at the same speed, and many continue with our really good ngfw, sdwan, dlp, cloud security and other products. you should feel at home in both worlds. it is essential that you have good experience particularly with sd-wan, ngfw, sase, dlp, and content security. what you will be doing: lead discussions with customers to drive understanding and documentation of the customer’s environment and needs, specifically their network security, dlp/intellectual property protection needs and recommend appropriate products/services that meet these needs. deliver product, technology and/or customized solution presentations to technical and business decision makers which may include system demonstrations, white-boarding and technical q&a sessions to the client. provide pre-sales technical support, security engineering and technical guidance for the development and implementation of forcepoint cybersecurity technologies for customer. work with customer, strategic partners, resellers and forcepoint team members to architect, design, build, and deploy cyber security solutions for customers and partners in support of pilot and proof of concept demonstrations. attend industry conferences, trade shows and sales events and participate in related activities. work with account managers and proposal team to develop technical content and diagrams for rfi/rfp responses orchestrate product specialists involvement during pre-sales activities collaborate with partners and professional services to design projects activities in order to have them aligned with customer expectations. what you can bring: a minimum of 3 years experience in a sales engineering role supporting enterprise software solutions previous demonstrated experience within cyber security pre-sales experience working directly with cyber security and/or network products in a team environment. experience with cloud security (sase) & network security (ngfw & sdwan) experience with data loss prevention projects, approach, and logic. strong customer relation/engagement skills ideally have experience working with enterprise accounts confident communicator, able to proactively engage with customer. ability to effectively communicate with a broad range of audiences; from deeply technical to high executive c-level decision makers. must be able to collaboratively coordinate across traditional engineering disciplines, management and customers. experience on routing and switching. knowledge of networking topology, tcp/ip protocol, proxy’s infrastructures, network architectures, and components (firewalls, routers, etc.) linux/windows systems administration experience preferred. strong understanding of customers and prospects requirements, security design and system architectures degree in computer engineering or equivalent engineering degree capable of developing empathy and rapport internally with staff and with customers and partners experience with building strong relationships throughout the sales cycle with our customer’s technical staff excellent technical skills on networking and administration handing deep technical discussion, troubleshooting, poc, etc. advanced understanding of enterprise networking, including saas and cloud solutions. don’t meet every single qualification? studies show people are hesitant to apply if they don’t meet all requirements listed in a job posting. forcepoint is focused on building an inclusive and diverse workplace – so if there is something slightly different about your previous experience, but it otherwise aligns and you’re excited about this role, we encourage you to apply. you could be a great candidate for this or other roles on our team. the policy of forcepoint is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity. forcepoint is committed to being an equal opportunity employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. if you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. you may request reasonable accommodations by sending an email to recruiting@forcepoint.com . applicants must have the right to work in the location to which you have applied.

name: FUTUER HORIAONS
title: Mechanical proposal engineer
description: · preparation of specifications and technical sheets for static and rotary equipment according to international and national standards · material selection · preparation of technical documents for piping, fittings and accessories · design of piping/pipeline installations · preparation of valve specifications and technical sheets · preparation of valve schedule, equipment list and mto · knowledge of asme, api, bpvc, mss-sp, astm, nfpa, bs, iso, tema, nace... and aramco, petronas… standards · preparation of the technical files for tenders · preparation of the technical submittals · verification of supplier documentation · meeting and negotiation with the client and the supplier understanding of piping & instrument diagram (p&id), process flow diagram (pfd), line sizing, sizing of equipment · preparation of technical documents in response to tender requirements, like method statements, project execution plan, time schedules, management plans, etc. assist in preparing cost data for proposals and contract negotiations determine proposal scope, define requirements develop and implement requirements for cost recording, reporting, and analyzing standards programs, and reports vendor selection & follow up to get budgetary offers for system equipment preparation of rfqs and communication with suppliers · support sales effort with timely response to technical and commercial questions from clients on multiple product lines. communicate with supplier to solve and conclude technical issues attending meeting with client to discuss technical issues coordinate bid and bid management with other departments نوع الوظيفة: دوام كامل

name: FATAYERJI CO.
title: Materials Lab. Supervisor
description: experience : 5-8 experience in ready mix concrete laboratory. duties & responsibilities ensure that all the tests are carried out in accordance with relevant standards . ensure that all tests are processed through the laboratory in expedient , quality conscious manner by preparing of daily testing program checking of the test data inserted in the worksheets before their submission to the concerned engineer for reporting . responsible to inform & check the h.o.d for any repair or calibration when required . responsible for storing of samples before and after testing for the specified duration .

name: Elliott Company
title: Application Engineer
description: overview & responsibilities purpose: become an expert in applications of a variety of centrifugal rotating equipment including compressors, steam turbines, expanders and pumps. develop and prepare technical solutions and proposals for new equipment for customers in petrochemical, lng and sustainability markets such as hydrogen, co2 (ccs/ccus), ammonia and energy storage. provide technical and commercial support to promote the business including strategic initiatives. interface with engineering, operational groups at our usa/japan factories, and with customers across the ema region in the development/clarification of proposal information. specific job responsibilities: respond to customer inquiries for new equipment. this involves the following key steps: review inquiry to understand goals of projects. work with sales to develop strategy by understanding market trends, customer needs, budget, & competition. design machines and auxiliaries including aerodynamic performance, rotordynamic stability and mechanical design analysis for entire scope of equipment. define scope of supply of equipment packages around the main units. conduct cost analysis including hardware, labour, engineering, drafting, vendor supplied components and all other costs related to the project. prepare specifications for major purchased auxiliaries and act as technical resource for subsequent vendor inquiries. create proposal including data sheets, scope, performance curves, pricing, delivery, comments/ exceptions to specifications and all other pertinent data. submit proposal to sales and aid sales in presenting proposal to customer if necessary. technical/commercial support during quote phase: answer technical/commercial questions from sales and customers concerning proposal. modify proposal as required from sales or customer concerning proposal. work with sales/management to adjust scope/delivery/price as needed to be competitive. participate in pre-contract meetings with sales/customer if required. transfer data to project teams in usa and japan after order received: prepare design specifications. attend kick-off and transfer meetings. assemble all pertinent information including inquiry specs, scope, costs, schedule, etc. to define project for project manager. act as technical/commercial resource for project manager throughout project. continuous improvement: automating standard, repeatable procedures and calculations. cooperation with other related groups (i.e.: new equipment and rerate group). keeping current with technology through magazines, trade shows, articles, on and off-site training, etc. studying customers and competition to identify market trends, new application of technology, innovations, etc. implement business/marketing plans and strategic initiatives: utilize technical and commercial skills and contacts to conduct market analyses. write reports to assist sales and marketing in selling new technology and developing new markets. support sales team with customer facing technical presentations following is a list of the primary skills/requirements of this position: bachelors degree or equivalent. extensive understanding of thermodynamic and aerodynamic concepts as related to the performance of turbomachinery including heat transfer, gas properties, efficiency, head, work, etc. application and design knowledge of steam turbines, compressors, pumps as well as their related auxiliaries (i.e. motors, gears, lube systems, etc.) ability to understand and balance the inter-relationship between price, performance, delivery, and reliability when selecting/designing a unit. good verbal and non-verbal communication skills for preparing proposals, conducting meetings, answering sales/customer questions and writing technical papers/articles/procedures. design/analytical skills in the application/design of bearings, seals, materials, thermal and dynamic stress and strain, rotor dynamics, etc. strong attention to detail in preparation of all documentation. computer skills including sun and ibm networks, application programs, word, excel, lotus notes, etc. good understanding of sustainability and emerging markets like hydrogen, ccs/ccus, ammonia, energy storage. travel is required to support sales in presenting proposals to customers and answering technical questions, participating in pre-contract meetings. travel may also be required to attend trade shows, present papers, participate in discussion groups. occasional travel required for training purposes. average 4- 6 trips per year, 2-3 days each. to learn more about our job applicant privacy notice, please click here .

name: Egis
title: ORAT Engineer M/F
description: general information organisation egis is an international player active in the consulting, construction engineering and mobility service sectors. we design and operate intelligent infrastructure and buildings capable of responding to the climate emergency and helping to achieve more balanced, sustainable and resilient territorial development. with operations in 120 countries, egis places the expertise of its 18,000 employees at the disposal of its clients and develops cutting-edge innovation accessible to all projects. improving people's quality of life and supporting communities in their social and economic development, whilst drastically reducing carbon emissions and achieving vital 2050 net zero targets, that's our purpose. reference 2024-12246 position description job title orat engineer m/f contract type permanent contract job description support the establishment and management of the detailed t&c and orat strategies and plans participate in and support planning, ramp up and execution of the various elements of airport and airline operational readiness programs develop operational concepts for new facilities and communicate those concepts to design teams leading the development and implementation of an integrated trials, examining and commissioning schedule which incorporates the necessary requirements, logic, and time frames needed for training to support transfer of the airport. ensure orat schedules are developed and integrated into project construction master schedule develop a comprehensive plan for transition of operations from existing to new facilities covering the areas of facility maintenance, operations, commercial, communications, finance, training and information technology establish and maintain strategic relationships with senior representatives of key stakeholders including airline and airport management, vendors, sub-concessionaires, consumer groups and the airport business community to ensure all stakeholders are engaged in the orat program. focus on ensuring technical systems meet their intended purpose, providing an effective framework to support staff operations and methodically trialing every component of all systems and developing mitigation plans to address any issues or deficiencies in the systems along with corrective action plans utilize reporting tools, such as sharepoint, risk registers; issue logs, dashboards, prolog, primavera, microsoft office, etc. to ensure orat activities and milestones are being achieved review project schedules, testing and close out plans for development of detailed turnover plans including duties & responsibilities of all parties develop, track and report on work plans to ensure transitions activities are progressing according to schedule, and all elements of the transition plan will be complete prior to opening day establish metrics to track effectiveness of operational plans and training; utilize data to adjust orat activities for future transition phases profile minimum of 10 years progressive experience relevant to orat good collaboration and interpersonal skills experience of orat, airport operations and commissioning/integration years of experience: 10 years educational background: bachelor of engineering registrations/certifications required saudi engineering council position location job location middle-east/north africa, saudi arabia city riyadh candidate criteria minimum level of education required 6-engineer’s degree minimum level of experience required over 10 years

name: Egis
title: Senior Engineer (Hydrological) M/F
description: general information organisation egis is an international player active in the consulting, construction engineering and mobility service sectors. we design and operate intelligent infrastructure and buildings capable of responding to the climate emergency and helping to achieve more balanced, sustainable and resilient territorial development. with operations in 120 countries, egis places the expertise of its 18,000 employees at the disposal of its clients and develops cutting-edge innovation accessible to all projects. improving people's quality of life and supporting communities in their social and economic development, whilst drastically reducing carbon emissions and achieving vital 2050 net zero targets, that's our purpose. reference 2024-12316 position description job title senior engineer (hydrological) m/f contract type permanent contract business line specific context overview: as a senior engineer in the tram or rail infrastructure program, you will play a crucial role in the planning, design, and implementation of drainage, hydrological, infrastructure, and traffic systems. you will be responsible for ensuring the efficient and safe operation of these systems within the tram or rail infrastructure program. your expertise and technical knowledge will contribute to the successful delivery of projects and the overall program objectives job description responsibilities: planning and design: lead and contribute to the planning and design of drainage, hydrological, infrastructure, and traffic systems in the tram or rail infrastructure program. this includes conducting feasibility studies, analyzing data, and developing engineering solutions that meet project requirements and comply with relevant regulations and standards. technical expertise: provide expert technical guidance and support to the engineering team and stakeholders. stay updated with the latest industry trends, best practices, and technological advancements related to drainage, hydrology, infrastructure, and traffic systems. project management: manage and coordinate engineering projects within the program, ensuring adherence to project timelines, budgets, and quality standards. collaborate with interdisciplinary teams, contractors, and consultants to ensure smooth project execution and successful delivery. risk assessment and mitigation: identify potential risks and challenges related to drainage, hydrology, infrastructure, and traffic systems within the tram or rail infrastructure program. develop strategies and measures to mitigate risks and ensure the safety and reliability of the systems. compliance and regulations: ensure compliance with relevant regulations, codes, and standards in the design, construction, and operation of drainage, hydrological, infrastructure, and traffic systems. liaise with regulatory authorities and stakeholders to obtain necessary approvals and permits. stakeholder engagement: collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, such as government agencies, consultants, contractors, and community groups. communicate effectively to address concerns, resolve issues, and ensure alignment between project objectives and stakeholder expectations. quality assurance: implement quality assurance processes to monitor and assess the performance of drainage, hydrological, infrastructure, and traffic systems. conduct inspections, tests, and evaluations to ensure compliance with project specifications and industry standards. profile skills: bachelor's or master's degree in civil engineering or a related field. professional engineering (pe) license is highly desirable. proven experience (typically 10+ years) in the design and implementation of hydrological. strong knowledge of relevant engineering principles, codes, and standards. proficiency in engineering software and tools for design, analysis, and modeling. excellent project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with diverse stakeholders. attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work. knowledge of tram or rail infrastructure systems and their operational requirements is an advantage. position location job location middle-east/north africa, saudi arabia city al ula candidate criteria minimum level of education required 6-engineer’s degree minimum level of experience required over 10 years

name: Ecolab Inc.
title: Technical Sales Representative - Sales Engineer
description: as the industry leader in water technology, we’re growing and need talented people like you to help us continue to protect the world’s most vital resource. nalco water, an ecolab company, seeks a technical sales representative to join its industry leading sales team. you’ll be responsible for revenue and profit growth of programs and services in targeted accounts. using a consultative sales approach, you’ll build relationships with existing customers by executing system assurance programs that meet their key business needs. with strong account leadership, you’ll also convert strategic competitive accounts and sell new technologies to current customers. what’s in it for you: you’ll join a growth company offering a competitive base salary, bonus structure and benefits. a company vehicle and cell phone a long term, advancing career path in service, sales or management. access to the industry’s most innovative training programs support from a dedicated technical service team. a culture that values safety first, including training and personal protection. pride in working for a company that provides clean water, safe food, abundant energy and healthy environments. what you will do: generate and execute sales plans in existing customer base and in assigned competitively held accounts, to meet profit increase goals. work closely with current and prospective customers to understand business needs and recommend continuous improvement and innovation plans that will maintain and grow sales. develop strong relationships with key stakeholders in current and prospective customers, including plant or facility executives. provide technical support to customers; identifying and resolving customer challenges, escalating as required. engage in problem solving by performing system analysis, interpreting data and providing written recommendations to ensure customer operations are performing at optimal levels. actively sell and support nalco water innovations and technology in assigned customers to promote long-term business relationships with nalco water territory/location information: this position is based in riyadh however candidate should be flexible to relocate around the kingdom. targeted accounts are within the light industries. minimum qualifications: bachelor's degree technical sales or field sales support experience possess a valid driver's license and acceptable motor vehicle record preferred qualifications: bachelor’s degree in engineering (chemical, mechanical, industrial) or life sciences (biology, chemistry, etc.) water treatment or specialty chemical industry experience working knowledge of or operations, wet end chemistry, pulp mill operations> about nalco water: in a world with increasing water shortage and contamination challenges, nalco water, an ecolab company, helps customers conserve more than 161 billion gallons of water each year. we work with customers across the world in the light industry (institutional, food & beverage, transportation and manufacturing), heavy industry (chemical, power and primary metals industries), paper and mining operations to reduce, reuse, and recycle their water while protecting their systems and equipment. nalco water provides the unique opportunity to work with a broad suite of technologies to deliver automated monitoring systems, data analysis and deep technical expertise to increase efficiency, sustainability and performance for our customers. #li-imea our commitment to diversity and inclusion ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of equal opportunity to employment. our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. we will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. in all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

name: Ecolab Inc.
title: Application Engineer
description: nalco, an ecolab company, is looking for an application engineer to join its industry leading nalco water team. if you are a passionate professional that enjoys interacting with customers and likes to work in an autonomous environment, we invite you to apply. you will be joining a talented team that supports water treatment applications for a variety of industries. in this position, you will manage and develop long standing client relationships, with an intense focus on exceeding client expectations and driving service delivery. you will have a hands-on approach to service and deliver value through developing and managing technical projects to solve customer problems. what’s in it for you: you will join a large growing company and work with some of our leading customers flexible, independent work environment where you will plan your own schedule access to best in class resources, tools, and technology enjoy a paid training program allowing you to learn from successful professionals comprehensive benefits packages in line with market and industry standards receive a company service vehicle for business & personal use opportunity for a long term, advanced career path in service, sales, corporate accounts or management thrive in a company that values a culture of safety to include top-notch safety training and personal protection equipment what you will do: provide routine service support to sales representatives in strategic water treatment district accounts to execute agreed upon customer system assurance and continuous improvement plans assist sales representatives with plant surveys of water treatment systems at prospective customers assist sales representatives with start-ups of new applications in both existing customers and in new accounts develop strong relationships with the key stakeholders in the strategic district accounts where you provide service support to other district sales representatives provide technical support to customers; identifying and resolving customer pain points, escalating as required engage in problem solving by performing system analysis, interpreting data and providing written recommendations to ensure customer operations are performing at optimal levels; support services include: sample testing, light maintenance, customer service, service report generation, chemical ordering, chemical inventory management, general labor activities follow ecolab safety guidelines and incident reporting requirements position details: candidate must reside in: riyadh. minimum qualifications: bachelor’s degree or equivalent in chemistry/chemical engineering 2 years of technical service or field sales support experience in water treatment must have a valid driver's license and acceptable motor vehicle record experience working with microsoft office suite physical demands: must be able to access and be comfortable with working in a variety of conditions and be able to perform the essential duties of the position. must be able to pass a drug screen and physical exam. preferred qualifications: water treatment or specialty chemical industry experience; working knowledge of boilers, cooling towers, and wastewater treatment systems would be an advantage. ability to sell value-added products to customers. carry aptitude and confidence to deal with large national and multi-national customers strong mechanical aptitude experience working with ms excel spreadsheets. about nalco water: in a world with increasing water shortage and contamination challenges, nalco water, an ecolab company, helps customers conserve more than 161 billion gallons of water each year. we work with customers across the world in the light industry (institutional, food & beverage, transportation and manufacturing), heavy industry (chemical, power and primary metals industries), paper and mining operations to reduce, reuse, and recycle their water while protecting their systems and equipment. nalco water provides the unique opportunity to work with a broad suite of technologies to deliver automated monitoring systems, data analysis and deep technical expertise to increase efficiency, sustainability and performance for our customers. #i-imea our commitment to diversity and inclusion ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of equal opportunity to employment. our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. we will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. in all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

name: Digital Grid
title: Enterprise Architect
description: job description summary job description ge digital grid software partners with electric grid utilities to deliver mission critical monitoring, analysis, and control system software worldwide and is seeking an enterprise solution architect that will serve as a chief technologist advisor to our prospects and customers. seeking stellar interpersonal communicator ready to help our prospects and customers understand our robust power system management offerings. responsible for external facing consultation on highly complex software opportunities that require in-depth domain knowledge or two or more specialized architecture areas. pursues activities and processes that help the sales organization achieve business objectives. high levels of commercial judgment are required to achieve outcomes required. requires specialized knowledge in t&d product lines, markets, sales processes, and customer groups. requires strong commercial awareness and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory. at the enterprise solution architect you will work with business stakeholders, technology leadership, and other architects to drive holistic technology implementation across value streams (i.e., a sets products, solutions, and services that deliver value to the customer) and enablers (i.e., the activities needed to provide future business functionality, including infrastructure, security, and compliance activities). you will rely on continuous feedback that fosters adaptive design and engineering practices, and drives collaboration between programs and teams around a common vision across each architectural domain (functional, application, data, infrastructure). you will develops end-to-end architecture approach, including strategy and vision, guiding principles, and standards, incorporating technology trends and business imperatives into the future state design. you will ensure that common architecture decisions are implemented consistently in order to support the business, ot and it strategy. guides solution and domain architects across the organization on industry-leading practices, ensuring solutions align with enterprise architecture standards. this role will: lead and coordinate the domain technical and business discussions relative to future architecture direction across the gridos product portfolio or product lines including ecosystem. engage with functional c-suite and senior leaders in both it and ot analyze design and develop a roadmap and implementation plan based upon a current vs. future state in a cohesive architecture viewpoint. review and/or analyze and develop architectural requirements at domain level within product portfolio or team. participate in the enterprise architecture domain governance model. contribute to the development of software and data delivery platforms with reusable components that can be orchestrated together into different methods. lead the research and evaluation of emerging technology, industry, and market trends to assist in project development and/or operational support activities. analyzes industry and market technology trends to inform and drive the organization's strategy and goals. leads, supports, and informs overall architecture approach, guiding principles, and standards on cross-organization initiatives. offers insight and research on innovative solutions and technology strategy. defines conceptual and logical architecture specifications in line with the enterprise standards for a particular portfolio of work. understands and communicates strategic themes (e.g., differentiating business objectives that connect a portfolio to the strategy of the enterprise) and other key business drivers for architecture to solution and domain architects and other non-technical stakeholders. drives architectural initiatives and develops architectural frameworks to enable the development, operations, maintenance, and enhancement of technology. works across value streams and enablers (i.e., an organizational construct for an end-to-end process that delivers value to the organization and its customers, in which reside groups and teams which deliver products and capabilities) to harmonize architecture and ensure the appropriate flow of information and data. ensures architecture decisions are consistent across the enterprise and leverage opportunities for common approaches. leads related architects to ensure alignment across value streams. maintains high-level, holistic vision of enterprise solutions and development initiatives and related reference models. engages with business stakeholders to innovate and improve business capabilities and to design enterprise technology solutions on a strong, resilient, digitally decoupled, and scalable architectural foundation. manages relationships with leadership, solution and domain architects, and engineers to ensure enterprise architecture principles are understood for broad adoption. operates with an agile mindset, modeling agility in leadership to encourage iterative delivery with a focus on business value. provides an expert-level technical perspective during roadmap and quarterly planning to drive the alignment of epics (i.e., a significant solution development initiative within a portfolio) to the overall strategic direction of the technology organization. technical leadership – demonstrates strong technical expertise across multiple technology domains, including deep technical specialty in one or more of the following areas: applications – adms, aems, vi, ai/ml, gis, mobile…, application platforms, software engineering, enterprise information management, collaboration, integration and interoperability, systems management, endpoint devices, network, security, cloud advanced technology trends - demonstrates a strong understanding of emerging trends in the technology landscape, including new technologies, processes, and ways of working. able to determine the impact of technological advancement on the company's systems, applications, infrastructure, and practices. advanced enterprise architecture strategy - strong ability to translate business strategy into objectives for technology; capability to create a holistic enterprise architecture (application, data, and technical) that enables capabilities aligned to business goals. advanced enterprise architecture - strong understanding of the end-to-end value chain of the organization, and ability to articulate the current grid landscape and how gridos builds the foundational platform to orchestrate the grid of the future knowledge and understanding of cloud platforms such as aws, azure, or google cloud. advanced communication for technical leadership - ability to communicate technical ideas and strategies effectively to non-technical audiences, including executive leadership, via multiple mediums (e.g., written communications, verbal communications, presentations, etc.) stakeholder management - ability to create and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders in order to drive outcomes and create alignment around a vision or course of action. business functional knowledge - knowledge and understanding of the business context, market and operational functions of the operating company, and the wider utilities industry. cross-functional collaboration - ability to participate in co-operative working relationships including knowledge sharing and partnership in achieving solutions within and across business or operational functions. intermediate required qualifications bachelor’s degree in computer science or “stem” majors (science, technology, engineering and math) or 10 years industry experience a solid background and understanding of electrical power systems and utility operations is required. experience providing thought leadership to an organization. must be willing to travel 35-50% desired: 10 years - progressive experience in software engineering, technology design, and/or it architecture across multiple products, systems, and/or platforms. must include experience in at least 2 it disciplines, such as solution design, enterprise applications, product lifecycle management (plm), middle-tier services, database management, storage, distributed computing, virtualization and/or application technology. experience delivering in devops environments, including experience with continuous integration / continuous delivery (ci/cd) pipelines and agile practices is preferred. additional information relocation assistance provided: no #li-remote - this is a remote position

name: BAE Systems
title: Avionic System Maintenance Technician Supervisor
description: avionic system maintenance technician supervisor salary: competitive location: al-majma’ah, saudi arabia job purpose bae systems is the uk government’s nominated prime contractor under the government-to-government arrangements that are in place to provide equipment, support and training to saudi arabia. we provide maintenance of royal saudi air force (rsaf) aircraft and train rsaf and royal saudi naval force personnel safely in a training environment in how to use their aircraft, equipment and weapons. bae systems saudi arabia is committed to supporting the saudi arabian national agenda including saudisation and the training and development of saudi national capability through the growth of the saudi national partner companies thereby reinforcing industrialisation and partnerships. the purpose of this job is to support the flying programme at king faisal air academy (kfaa) by ensuring the efficient accomplishment of oat training aircraft for scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, and that work is carried out in a managed and controlled manner and in accordance with all applicable technical data. the achievement of this primary goal is realised through the effective direction & motivation of their team and through good, effective liaison with other departments. provides on the job training (ojt) function and task certification. also to delegate, supervise, monitor and expedite intermediate maintenance activities being carried out on oat training aircraft platforms. responsible for the management and control of section maintenance tasks and assigned manpower, to ensure the efficient completion of scheduled, non-scheduled, aircraft maintenance and section support tasks. job accountabilities to provide technical specialty support in the: evaluation, interpretation, determinations of requisite corrective actions, performance and operational status of specialty specific aircraft systems and components. responsible for supporting the maintenance squadron, ensuring the shift organization can meet task requirements and for maintaining close liaison with maintenance operations control, quality department and intermediate maintenance to prioritise and progress aircraft work. provide support as necessary to tagf operations, aircrew assistance, airfield recovery, crash recovery and be fully conversant with aircrew debrief procedures. must provide every assistance towards aircraft maintenance activities, to fully support the oat flying schedule. responsible for the management, supervision and training of assigned manpower. ensuring assigned maintenance technicians are fully trained and certified to accomplish assigned tasks. accountable for section tool control procedures and section technical publication sub-section. to provide informal and formal on the job training (ojt) for all personnel to enable either rsaf or civilian saudisation of intermediate maintenance operations. able to acquire user expertise and become conversant with the rsaf aircraft data management and tracking computer system –miro gold. able to understand and comply with the rsaf safety and foreign object programme. recruitment specification essential qualifications: national civilian / military equivalent recognised aircraft maintenance traineeship / apprenticeship have extensive proven post qualification practical maintenance experience within operational flying aircraft environment supported by formal recorded workplace applied related training or extensive experience on same aircraft type must be trained in aircraft engineering or a related technical discipline at a civilian or military school of technical training, or have completed an appropriate engineering apprenticeship working knowledge of q-pulse, dms and thorough understanding of m&ca mandates and processes. be able to motivate people in a mixed ee/sn workforce must be able to work on their own initiative to resolve complex technical issues support the superintendents in the assigned work areas during periods of absence by the incumbent. have current knowledge and experience associated with aircraft maintenance, quality assurance, logistical support, and repairable asset management computer literacy is essential, with a good working knowledge of the microsoft office suite, goldesp and dms systems. desirable a sound understanding of the rsaf 4-1-7166 series and supporting technical publications applicable to their work area an understanding of the rsaf operation and working practices have completed appropriate aircraft systems specific training course and completed suitable ojt qualification. hold certification privileges for maintenance red x release and aircraft tow team supervisor/driver. recruitment the job holder should have the following background: knowledge of relevant parts of the moe and procedures ability to confirm full accomplishment of maintenance tasks understanding of personnel authorisations and limitations ability to prioritise tasks & report discrepancies use, control, be familiar with required tooling and equipment expatriate employee benefits in return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary, rent free accommodation and access to free recreation facilities, all available within company secured accommodation. in addition, a generous leave and travel allowance makes this an opportunity not to be missed. on successfully securing a role your appointment to saudi arabia will initially be on single status. on commencement of employment in saudi arabia you will have the opportunity to apply to have your family join you in the future. a full health care scheme is provided within saudi arabia. bae systems at bae systems, we provide some of the world’s most advanced, technology-led defence, aerospace and security solutions. we employ a skilled workforce of 89,600 people in more than 40 countries. working with customers and local partners, we develop, engineer, manufacture, and support products and systems to deliver military capability, protect national security and people, and keep critical information and infrastructure secure. all appointments in saudi arabia are subject to receipt of all necessary government and/or customer approvals.

name: رايسي للتجارة والمقاولات المحدودة
title: Site Protection Engineer
description: job description : objective/mission: engineer with control and protection application design knowledge, relay configuration, fat and site commissioning experience by holding an engineer-bachelor's degree from a recognized and reputed institution with minimum experience of 5 years in electrical /power system engineering domain. - provides technical designs to customer projects & services teams, by having good technical knowledge and knowhow in an application domain or subdomain; - identifies and understands customer technical requirements related to his/her application domain/subdomain; - applies internal procedures, standards & best practices in autonomy, related to his/her application domain/subdomain; - communicates results internally and to customers; presents and arguments them during project technical reviews; - may provide some commercial argumentation to project teams or management, and report potential technical risks; - may provide instructions/assistance to dat3. scope and environment works both in autonomy and in team work, with contribution to project or service teams' technical solution designs. works mainly for internal
